summary: Thomas Howarth is identified as an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents mentioning him primarily consist of payroll authorization forms and related memoranda detailing his salary and position changes within the HSCA from 1976 to 1978. There is one document specifically titled "Staff Payroll Records for Thomas Howarth, HSCA" dated December 1, 1976, which confirms his employment. The documents do not provide specific details about his role within the HSCA or his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination beyond his employment status and associated payroll information. The documents are primarily administrative in nature, focusing on payroll and personnel matters.
significance: Thomas Howarth's significance in the JFK assassination context appears to be limited to his role as a staff member within the HSCA. The documents suggest he was a regular employee whose payroll records were maintained by the committee. The available information does not indicate any direct involvement in investigative activities or any specific connection to the JFK assassination beyond his employment with the HSCA.
